intro: Syzygium prainianum subsp. prainianum, commonly known as the Malabar black pepper. It is a flowering plant in the Myrtaceae family, native to the Western Ghats of India. The plant is characterized by its small, dark purple to black berries that are used as a spice. It typically grows in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests. The leaves are elliptical, leathery, and have a distinctive aromatic scent.
